sentences.en: A sudden twinge of feeling brought him to a dead stop.
sentences.cn: 突然一阵内疚又使他停住了脚步.

sentences.en: A twinge of fear went through him.
A twinge of pain shot through Winston's jaw.
For a moment, Arnold felt a twinge of sympathy for Mr Wilson.
sentences.cn: 有一瞬间，阿诺德对威尔逊先生心生同情。

sentences.en: Has your action never given you a twinge of conscience?
sentences.cn: 你做这事不屈心 吗 ?

sentences.en: He could not help feeling a twinge of panic.
sentences.cn: 他不由得一阵心慌意乱.

sentences.en: He felt a slight twinge in his damaged hamstring.
sentences.cn: 他受伤的腘绳肌感到一阵轻微的刺痛。

sentences.en: He felt a twinge in his knee.
He sometimes experiences a twinge or two; nothing serious.
sentences.cn: 他只是有时感到有一两阵刺痛, 情况并不严重.

sentences.en: I feel a twinge in my back now and again.
I felt a twinge of envy for the people who lived there.
sentences.cn: 我对住在那儿的人产生过一阵嫉妒.

sentences.en: I felt a twinge of pain in my back.
Some parts of body feel stabbing pain or twinge.
sentences.cn: 身体某些部份感到刺痛或剧痛.

sentences.en: The letter still gives him a twinge when he thinks of it.
sentences.cn: 他一想起那封信就会感到一阵刺痛.

sentences.en: This gave me more than a twinge of uneasiness.
sentences.cn: 这件事使我内心非常不安.

sentences.en: You can neither blame nor commend him without some twinge of conscience.
sentences.cn: 你无论是责备他或是称赞他,良心上总不免有点刺痛的意味似的.

trans.tran_cn: 阵痛，刺痛，一阵思绪（通常指不快的），痛苦
trans.tran_en: a sudden feeling of slight pain
